channel.title: The Petty Prophet Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Joel Berry
channel.description: The Petty Prophet is your source for culture, politics, satire, and news from a Christian worldview! Each week we release one episode of satire and op-ed, and one episode of group discussions on everything to theology, current politics, pop-culture, and family. Make us a part of your weekly routine and you are sure to come away encouraged and enriched. For more info, visit www.thepettyprophet.com or write to me at contact@thepettyprophet.com
channel.itunes:keywords: Christian, Satire, Politics, News, Science, Philosophy, Family, Fatherhood, Conversation

item.itunes:summary: The Berry brothers sit down for another discussion on Paul David Tripp's recent woke "coming out" video. We also respond to Phil Vischer's video on systemic racism, Eric Mason's book Woke Church, and Nick Cannon's canceling. Sam's baby is on the way and still healthy! Responding to Paul David TrippEric Mason's Woke ChurchNick Cannon and Black NationalismWhat if Obi-Wan was voiced by Donald Duck? item.description:
The Berry brothers sit down for another discussion on Paul David Tripp's recent woke "coming out" video. We also respond to Phil Vischer's video on systemic racism, Eric Mason's book Woke Church, and Nick Cannon's canceling. 

  • Sam's baby is on the way and still healthy! 
  • Responding to Paul David Tripp
  • Eric Mason's Woke Church
  • Nick Cannon and Black Nationalism
  • What if Obi-Wan was voiced by Donald Duck? 

Resources mentioned in the episode:
Neil Shenvi's review of Woke Church by Eric Mason
Rosaria Butterfield's excellent critique of Woke Church and intersectionality
Jon Harris's website - great resource for understanding the debate
Paul David Tripp's Video
Phil Vischer's Video
Slow to Write Blog
Tim Challies summary of White Fragility
Desiring God - Seeing the World in Black and White
Obi-Wan and Anakin voiced by Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck

item.itunes:title: Ep. #70 - The Statues
item.title: Ep. #70 - The Statues
item.itunes:summary: All around the country we are seeing statues and symbols torn down. We are seeing people canceled, their lives destroyed. This is nothing new. It can be traced back to an ancient guilt ritual over 5,000 years old. Christ was the fulfillment of that ritual and the sacrifice for that guilt, and our country has forgotten Him.
item.description:

item.itunes:title: Ep. #65 - From Darwin to Jim Crow To Hitler (repost)
item.title: Ep. #65 - From Darwin to Jim Crow To Hitler (repost)
item.itunes:summary: Why did racism and segregation against black Americans persist so long after the end of slavery? The answer is pretty shocking and disturbing, at least to me. Let's talk about it. In this episode: Why has racism persisted?Why I'm skeptical of "settled science" Polygenism v MonogenismDarwin enters the sceneThe Eugenics movement is bornHuman Zoos in America and the story of Ota BengaThe eugenicists who inspired HitlerHow the legacy of the scientific racism and eugenics movement stil...
item.description:
Why did racism and segregation against black Americans persist so long after the end of slavery? The answer is pretty shocking and disturbing, at least to me. Let's talk about it. 

In this episode:

  • Why has racism persisted?
  • Why I'm skeptical of "settled science" 
  • Polygenism v Monogenism
  • Darwin enters the scene
  • The Eugenics movement is born
  • Human Zoos in America and the story of Ota Benga
  • The eugenicists who inspired Hitler
  • How the legacy of the scientific racism and eugenics movement still continues today
  • What are we to make of this? 

Sources:

Documentary about Human Zoos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nY6Zrol5QEk
Scientific Racism Wiki: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_racism
The Racism of PT Barnum https://cinemacy.com/the-greatest-showman-revises-the-dark-history-of-p-t-barnum/
Eugenics Wiki: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugenics#cite_note-credoreference.com-20
Planned Parenthood and the eugenics movement: https://www.liveaction.org/news/planned-parenthoods-connections-to-eugenics/
Polygenism: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polygenism
Leanard Darwin wiki: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_Darwin
Madison Grant Wiki: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madison_Grant
What America taught the Nazis: https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2017/11/what-america-taught-the-nazis/540630/

item.title: Ep. #61 - Meditating Like A Boss
item.itunes:summary: It's the weekly Man Hug! This week the Berry brothers talk about different types of meditation as a means for focusing on God and His word. This includes things like centering prayer and contemplative prayer. Is this stuff legit? Is it useful to the Christian? item.description:
In this episode, I interview Joel and Troy who are the creators of my new favorite podcast: Revived Thoughts. 

Revived Thoughts is a weekly podcast that helps you discover history's greatest sermons.

"It wasn’t that long ago when people read sermons. Pastors and preachers would have their sermons written down and sent out for everyone to read. It was similar to how we read blogs today. But this all stopped when audio was invented.

After people started to listen to sermons on the radio, they stopped reading them. Sermons should be heard. The old sermons that were written down were forgotten. For over a hundred years countless great sermons haven’t been heard by anyone. And we limit ourselves by choosing only to listen to sermons from today.

This is all changing! Our goal is to bring these sermons back to life. Many great theologians were preachers, missionaries, and professors. We read their books today. But what did they tell their congregations? What was their week to week advice on how to live? The way to live out their theology is found in their sermons."   

Link to their site: https://revivedthoughts.com/
On Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/revived-thoughts/id1461685901
Revived Thoughts Patreon to support financially and enjoy bonus content: https://www.patreon.com/RevivedThoughts

item.itunes:title: Ep. #53 - Current Events and Wisdom Spewing
item.title: Ep. #53 - Current Events and Wisdom Spewing
item.itunes:summary: Lightning round through current events with the Berry Brothers Is it ok to make fun of Brian Stelter crying himself to sleep? Are we losing the meaning of leadership or are we looking in the wrong places?What does Leadership look like during the COVID Pandemic Would you have ever guessed that America would operate with a Federalist mindset in the midst of a global pandemic? Is this the end of globalization and the rise of nationalistic ideals? Is China the new USSR? Is a hot wa...
item.description:
Lightning round through current events with the Berry Brothers

  • Is it ok to make fun of Brian Stelter crying himself to sleep? Are we losing the meaning of leadership or are we looking in the wrong places?
  • What does Leadership look like during the COVID Pandemic 
  • Would you have ever guessed that America would operate with a Federalist mindset in the midst of a global pandemic? 
  • Is this the end of globalization and the rise of nationalistic ideals? 
  • Is China the new USSR? Is a hot war with China on the horizon? As of this week, we are seeing multiple military demonstrations and threats, including, more frighteningly a war of disinformation being waged from China across the world. 
  • How do you feel about DeBlasio using tried and true nazi Gestapo tactics of encouraging New Yorkers to report their neighbors.
  • So… the latest is that poor white disgruntled men are the ones denying science and protesting government shutdowns. So… I’m confused. Are White men privileged elitist rich people? Or are they poor disgruntled trump deplorables? Please help, reality is broken. 
  • On that note… Is protesting good or bad? Remember how honorable the disease-ridden occupy wall street protests were? I’m still confused. I thought “Speaking Truth to Power” is a good thing?
  • Regarding this, Facebook has shut down anti-quarantine protests because of States Request. Thoughts? Reference is an article from Politico. 
  • Youtube is banning anything they see as misinformation. What is the definition of YouTube’s misinformation? Quote: “Anything that would go against the World Health Organization (WHO) recommendations would be a violation of our policy.” This is the same organization that propped up Chinese propaganda by downplaying the COVID-19 virus at the beginning. Is there a connection?

item.itunes:title: Ep. #50 - Proverbs For Social Media (repost)
item.title: Ep. #50 - Proverbs For Social Media (repost)
item.itunes:summary: “A fool gives full vent to his spirit, ​but a wise man quietly holds it back.” ​(Prov. 29:11) “If a wise man has an argument with a fool, the fool only rages and laughs, and there is no quiet.” ​(Prov. 29:9) “A fool takes no pleasure in understanding, ​but only in expressing his opinion.” ​(Prov. 18:2) ​ “If one gives an answer before he hears, ​it is a folly and shame.” ​(Prov. 18:13) “When words are many, transgression is not lacking, ​but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.” ​(Pro...
item.description:
“A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
​but a wise man quietly holds it back.”
​(Prov. 29:11)


“If a wise man has an argument with a fool,
the fool only rages and laughs, and there is no quiet.”
​(Prov. 29:9)


“A fool takes no pleasure in understanding,
​but only in expressing his opinion.”
​(Prov. 18:2)

​

“If one gives an answer before he hears,
​it is a folly and shame.”
​(Prov. 18:13)


“When words are many, transgression is not lacking,
​but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.”
​(Prov. 10:19)


“There is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts,
​but the tongue of the wise brings healing.”
​(Prov. 12:18)


“Whoever meddles in a quarrel not his own
 is like one who takes a passing dog by the ears.”
​(Prov. 26.17)


“By the mouth of a fool comes a rod for his back,
But the lips of the wise will preserve them.“
(Prov. 14:3)


“The vexation of a fool is known at once,
​but the prudent ignores an insult.”
​(Prov. 12:16)

 

​“A soft answer turns away wrath:
but a harsh word stirs up anger.”
(Prov. 15:1)

“A fool takes no pleasure in understanding,
​but only in expressing his opinion.”
​(Prov. 18:2)

​

“If one gives an answer before he hears,
​it is a folly and shame.”
​(Prov. 18:13)


“When words are many, transgression is not lacking,
​but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.”
​(Prov. 10:19)


“There is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts,
​but the tongue of the wise brings healing.”
​(Prov. 12:18)

“The vexation of a fool is known at once,

​“A soft answer turns away wrath:
but a harsh word stirs up anger.”
(Prov. 15:1)

item.itunes:title: Ep. #44 - I Read Roe v. Wade And It's Worse Than I Thought
item.title: Ep. #44 - I Read Roe v. Wade And It's Worse Than I Thought
item.itunes:summary: I decided to read Roe v. Wade. All 21 pages of single-spaced legal language. I was appalled by what I found. Here are some of my initial thoughts: It intentionally sets ethical progress back 2000 yearsIt invents rights that are not in the constitutionIt relies on junk science by citing unqualified people and eugenicists (yes, eugenicists)Is it time to ignore Roe v Wade? I think so. https://www.law.cornell.edu/supremecourt/text/410/113#writing-USSC_CR_0410_0113_ZO
item.description:
I decided to read Roe v. Wade. All 21 pages of single-spaced legal language.  I was appalled by what I found. Here are some of my initial thoughts: 

  • It intentionally sets ethical progress back 2000 years
  • It invents rights that are not in the constitution
  • It relies on junk science by citing unqualified people and eugenicists (yes, eugenicists)

Is it time to ignore Roe v Wade?  I think so. 

https://www.law.cornell.edu/supremecourt/text/410/113#writing-USSC_CR_0410_0113_ZO
item.content:encoded:
I decided to read Roe v. Wade. All 21 pages of single-spaced legal language.  I was appalled by what I found. Here are some of my initial thoughts: 

  • It intentionally sets ethical progress back 2000 years
  • It invents rights that are not in the constitution
  • It relies on junk science by citing unqualified people and eugenicists (yes, eugenicists)

Is it time to ignore Roe v Wade?  I think so. 

https://www.law.cornell.edu/supremecourt/text/410/113#writing-USSC_CR_0410_0113_ZO

item.title: Ep. #35 - Getting To Know The Giver / Fighting Over A Transgender Child
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, I talk through some of my thoughts in response to the sentiment expressed by some secular humanists: "Why does it matter where our morality comes from? If love for our neighbor is a self-evident good, who cares what the source of it is?" I have two thoughts in response to this: Joy is made full in a relationship with the giver of a giftThe source of our morality has great bearing on what our morality looks likeThe case of James Younger, a 7-year-old boy whose mother claims h...
item.description:
In this episode, I talk through some of my thoughts in response to the sentiment expressed by some secular humanists: "Why does it matter where our morality comes from? If love for our neighbor is a self-evident good, who cares what the source of it is?"

I have two thoughts in response to this:

  • Joy is made full in a relationship with the giver of a gift
  • The source of our morality has great bearing on what our morality looks like
  • The case of James Younger, a 7-year-old boy whose mother claims he is a transgender girl, is a current example of this dilemma. 

Here is a link to David's episode of The Graceful Atheist I reference in this talk: https://open.spotify.com/episode/1k7Wluh4fLJlhlACjub5y5?t=0

Why did racism and segregation against black Americans persist so long after the end of slavery? The answer is pretty shocking and disturbing, at least to me. Let's talk about it. 

In this episode:

  • Why I'm skeptical of "settled science" 
  • Polygenism v Monogenism
  • Darwin enters the scene
  • The Eugenics movement is born

  • How the legacy of the scientific racism and eugenics movement still continues today
  • What are we to make of this?

Scientific Racism Wiki: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_racism

item.itunes:title: Episode 22: Valuable Life Lessons From The Marine Corps
item.title: Episode 22: Valuable Life Lessons From The Marine Corps
item.itunes:summary: I share the 5 main life lessons I took away from my experience in the Marine Corps. Be ThankfulDo what you do not feel like doing. Do it now.You only get out what you put inCaring for others will get you further than any skill or proficiencyBe OK with how God made you, even as you work to improveI also will tell you why I take the garbage out in my bare feet during winter!
item.description:
I share the 5 main life lessons I took away from my experience in the Marine Corps.

  • Be Thankful
  • Do what you do not feel like doing. Do it now.
  • You only get out what you put in
  • Caring for others will get you further than any skill or proficiency
  • Be OK with how God made you, even as you work to improve

I also will tell you why I take the garbage out in my bare feet during winter!
item.content:encoded:

  • Wrapping it up

item.itunes:title: Episode 15: King Solomon Predicted Twitter 3000 Years Ago
item.title: Episode 15: King Solomon Predicted Twitter 3000 Years Ago
item.itunes:summary: “A fool gives full vent to his spirit, ​but a wise man quietly holds it back.” ​(Prov. 29:11) “If a wise man has an argument with a fool, the fool only rages and laughs, and there is no quiet.” ​(Prov. 29:9) “A fool takes no pleasure in understanding, ​but only in expressing his opinion.” ​(Prov. 18:2) ​ “If one gives an answer before he hears, ​it is a folly and shame.” ​(Prov. 18:13) “When words are many, transgression is not lacking, ​but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.” ​(Pro...
item.description:
“A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
​but a wise man quietly holds it back.”
​(Prov. 29:11)


“If a wise man has an argument with a fool,
the fool only rages and laughs, and there is no quiet.”
​(Prov. 29:9)


“A fool takes no pleasure in understanding,
​but only in expressing his opinion.”
​(Prov. 18:2)

​

“If one gives an answer before he hears,
​it is a folly and shame.”
​(Prov. 18:13)


“When words are many, transgression is not lacking,
​but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.”
​(Prov. 10:19)


“There is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts,
​but the tongue of the wise brings healing.”
​(Prov. 12:18)


“Whoever meddles in a quarrel not his own
 is like one who takes a passing dog by the ears.”
​(Prov. 26.17)


“By the mouth of a fool comes a rod for his back,
But the lips of the wise will preserve them.“
(Prov. 14:3)


“The vexation of a fool is known at once,
​but the prudent ignores an insult.”
​(Prov. 12:16)

 

​“A soft answer turns away wrath:
but a harsh word stirs up anger.”
(Prov. 15:1)
item.content:encoded:
“A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
​but a wise man quietly holds it back.”
​(Prov. 29:11)


“If a wise man has an argument with a fool,
the fool only rages and laughs, and there is no quiet.”
​(Prov. 29:9)


“A fool takes no pleasure in understanding,
​but only in expressing his opinion.”
​(Prov. 18:2)

​

“If one gives an answer before he hears,
​it is a folly and shame.”
​(Prov. 18:13)


“When words are many, transgression is not lacking,
​but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.”
​(Prov. 10:19)


“There is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts,
​but the tongue of the wise brings healing.”
​(Prov. 12:18)


“Whoever meddles in a quarrel not his own
 is like one who takes a passing dog by the ears.”
​(Prov. 26.17)


“By the mouth of a fool comes a rod for his back,
But the lips of the wise will preserve them.“
(Prov. 14:3)


“The vexation of a fool is known at once,
​but the prudent ignores an insult.”
​(Prov. 12:16)

 

​“A soft answer turns away wrath:
but a harsh word stirs up anger.”
(Prov. 15:1)
